bonzai.api

Class AIGameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • bonzai.api.AIGameState

  • public class AIGameState
extends java.lang.Object
    AIGameState provides functions to get information and objects present in the world each turn. Pathfinding functions are provided, but use them wisely because they can be time expensive.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(int x,
           int y)
        Get a specific, Node from the grid
        Parameters:
        x - : target x location
        y - : target y location
        Returns:
        The Node with the corresponding x and y values or 'null' if the x and y values are out of bounds.

        Valid x and y values include integers that are greater than or equal to 0, x values that are less than getWidth(), and y values that are less than getHeight().

        See Also:
        Node.getX(), Node.getY()

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the map.
        Returns:
        The width of the map.
        See Also:
        Node.getX()

        Returns:

        See Also:

      • getMyTeamNumber

        public int getMyTeamNumber()
        Gets your team number. The team numbers start at 1.
        Returns:
        Your team number.
        See Also:
        getNumberOfPlayers()

      • getPlayerScore

        public final int getPlayerScore(int player)
        Gets the given player's current score.
        Returns:
        The given player's current score, or -1 if the team is invalid.

      • getPlayerMana

        public final int getPlayerMana(int player)

        Gets the given player's current mana if that player's Wizard is visible. Mana is the resource your Wizard uses to cast magic.

        Returns:
        The amount of mana the given player currently possesses. If an improper index or a team without a visible wizard is given, it returns -1.

      • getMyScore

        public final int getMyScore()
        Gets your current score.
        Returns:
        Your current score.

      • getMyMana

        public final int getMyMana()

        Gets your current mana. Mana is the resource your Wizard uses to cast magic.

        Returns:
        The amount of mana you currently possess.

      • getNumberOfPlayers

        public final int getNumberOfPlayers()
        Gets the number of players on the map.
        Returns:
        The max number of players.
        See Also:
        getMyTeamNumber()

      • getMyBase

        public final Node getMyBase()
        Gets the location of your base, which is the Node where your hat starts out on. This is also the Node where you must send hats that you are attempting to capture.
        Returns:
        The location of your base as a Node.

      • getBase

        public final Node getBase(int team)

        Gets the node where the team's hat sits to generate mana and points. Each team's base location is known. The team numbers start at 1 and goes through (which includes) getNumberOfPlayers()

        Parameters:
        team - : the team id of the desired player's base
        Returns:
        The corresponding team's base as a Node, which contains that team's hat.
        See Also:
        getMyTeamNumber(), getNumberOfPlayers()

      • getLocation

        public final Node getLocation(Actor actor)
        Gets the Node that the given Actor is on.
        Parameters:
        actor - : the Actor that you want to get the location from.
        Returns:
        The Node that the Actor is currently standing on.

      • getRogueHats

        public java.util.ArrayList<Hat> getRogueHats()
        Gets an array list of hats which you own, but others have taken control of. This includes hats which are not visible, so be sure to handle special cases.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of hats owned by you but controlled by others, regardless of visibility.

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(Actor actor,
               Node dest,
               WeightComparator comp)
        Determine the next direction to move (calls getPath()- consider caching instead)
        Parameters:
        actor - : the actor who is moving
        dest - : the destination node
        comp - : a WeightComparator to evaluate each tile
        Returns:
        the direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT) or -1 if there is an error

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(Node start,
               Node dest,
               WeightComparator comp)
        Determine the next direction to move (calls getPath()- consider caching instead)
        Parameters:
        start - : the start node
        dest - : the destination node
        comp - : a WeightComparator to evaluate each tile
        Returns:
        the direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT) or -1 if there is an error

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(java.util.ArrayList<Node> path)
        Get the first direction in a path from getPath()
        Parameters:
        path - : a path returned from getPath(Node, Node, WeightComparator)
        Returns:
        the direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT) or -1 if there is an error

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(java.util.ArrayList<Node> path,
               int step)
        Get the next direction in a path from getPath()
        Parameters:
        path - : a path returned from getPath()
        step - : the number of steps already taken along the path
        Returns:
        the direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT) or -1 if there is an error

      • getProgress

        public final int getProgress(Actor actor,
              java.util.ArrayList<Node> path)
        Find an actor along a path from getPath()
        Parameters:
        actor - : the actor to find along the path
        path - : a path returned from getPath()
        Returns:
        what step along the path the actor is at, or -1 if it's not on the path can be used to find the step, for getDirection(path, step)

      • getPath

        public final java.util.ArrayList<Node> getPath(Actor start,
                                Node dest,
                                WeightComparator comp)
        Gets the path from an actor to the destination node
        Parameters:
        start - : an actor to start the path from
        dest - : the final destination
        comp - : WeightComparator to evaluate each tile along the way
        Returns:
        an list of nodes in the path from start to dest, or an empty array if there is no path

      • getPath

        public final java.util.ArrayList<Node> getPath(Node start,
                                Node dest,
                                WeightComparator comp)
        Gets the path from the start node to the destination node
        Parameters:
        start - : the starting position
        dest - : the final destination
        comp - : WeightComparator to evaluate each tile along the way
        Returns:
        an list of nodes in the path from start to dest, or an empty array if there is no path
